articles.title: ‘Pokemon Go’ Studio Niantic Sold in $3.5B Deal to Mobile Gaming Giant Scopely - Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: Niantic will sell its gaming business to Scopely, including 'Pokemon Go,' 'Pikmin Bloom' in a deal that transforms the mobile gaming landscape.

articles.title: Apple adds new disclaimer on its website advertising delayed AI Siri features - 9to5Mac
articles.description: Apple is still reeling from the last-week’s news that the most compelling new Apple Intelligence features for Siri have been...

articles.title: North Korean government hackers snuck spyware on Android app store - TechCrunch
articles.description: Cybersecurity firm Lookout found several samples of a North Korean spyware it calls KoSpy.

articles.title: Google calls Gemma 3 the most powerful AI model you can run on one GPU - The Verge
articles.description: Google’s Gemma 3 AI models are “open” versions of the technology behind its Gemini AI, which it says can outperform competition from DeepSeek, Meta, and OpenAI.

articles.title: Microsoft quantum breakthrough claims labelled 'unreliable' and 'essentially fraudulent' - The Register
articles.description: Redmond insists it's got this right and has even more impressive results to share soon

articles.title: Space Force's Secret Plane Returns After More Than a Year in Orbit - ScienceAlert
articles.description: The X-37B is a reusable robotic space plane operated by the US Space Force.
